body: Hi @kretsge! Could you post screenshots of your config.yaml? It looks like there is something wrong with TrainFraction.
Hi! Here are the screenshots of my config.yaml file. Let me know what you think.
@kretsge, what did you mean above by training with iteration 1? Was `trainsetindex`=0?

Maybe this is a misunderstanding on my end. When I used older versions of DLC, after I went through the refinement step and merged datasets, when I re-ran “train network” it would automatically update to iteration 1. Should that not be what happens here after refining the data and merging the datasets?
hi @kretsge thanks for the added details, indeed it should be as you say, i.e. after merge data it bumps up to 1 and it should retrain. I will check a few things and get back to you!
Ok, thank you so much! Let me know if you need any other information from me.
Hi- I just wanted to check back in about this issue in case it got lost in the shuffle.  Thanks for your help!
Hi @kretsge apologies; I couldn't reproduce the issues, but want to try one more thing! Will be in touch this week 👍

hi @kretsge I double checked, and had no issues :/

Let me be clear on my workflow: created a new project, labeled 4 frames, trained for 200 iterations, ran video analysis and tracking GUI to get an .h5 file. Then, extracted 4 outliers, refined them in the GUI, clicked merge, which takes you back to create-training dataset tab, created set, and then went to train again...

I would suggest bumping up to the latest, which would require you to just run the following in the env:

`pip install git+https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut.git`

Then I tried the other workflow, or supplemental workflow: i.e., I grabbed edited frames from the Tracklet GUI. I.e., if you "drag" any points in the GUI you can save those edited frames to throw back into the dataset. So here, I click "optional merge refined frames" and then went to the refine labels tab, clicked MERGE," which bumps it up to 2, then I create training dataset, and train again:

Thank you for your response! I decided to start a new project from scratch and see if I ran into the same issue. I'm just about to refine the labels so I wanted to double check with you that I'm doing this correctly. I did the "refine tracklets" step and clicked "optional: merge refined data" for a few different videos (merging after each video). Next I extracted outlier frames and went to the "refine labels" tab. When I launched the GUI I saw that I had these videos with hundreds of frames to label, which seems like a lot (see attached image). So a few questions: 1) Should I be merging the data/creating new datasets/training the network after refining the tracklets? Or can I refine tracklets, merge the data, refine the labels, merge that data, and then create a new training dataset with all of that together? 2) When I used the older (not multi-animal) version of DLC I would only do about 20 frames per video when refining. Is there a way to not refine the hundreds of frames per video that I've extracted? Is there a way to get rid of these frames that I've already extracted without messing up the data? Again, thank you so much for your help. I hope this new project I've started will work and there was just some error I made the first time around!
@kretsge, unless I misunderstood you,  outlier frames should be extracted and re-labeled prior to merging the data.
